attributes.action: Make  landlords insurance commission illegal where charged to occupiers
attributes.additional_details:
One case is a small studio flat - the owner/occupier has a quote of £93, while the actual premium being charged is £433, plus an unjustified administration fee of £19.99 per flat.

The are endless cases that can be searched on the Lands Tribunal web site, and just one of these is reference CAM/00KF/LSC/2010/0111

Most of these cases are found in favour of the Applicant/occupier, proving that this is widespread, and should be legislated against to make the process unnecessary.
attributes.background: Thousands of landlords all over the country make millions of pounds in excess profit from flat and other owners, and commercial tenants by over-pricing buildings insurance premiums they recharge, then receiving secret commission back from insurers. This can be 3-4 times the actual premium or more.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government and Parliament to make it illegal for freeholders to receive insurance commission, if that's what you want to happen.
